info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 3 at 9:52AM CDT until August 3 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham AL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Cleburne.
* WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 949 AM CDT, emergency management reported several roadways remain flooded. Local rivers are beginning to rise due to recent rainfall. Flooding is already occurring. Between 5 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Heflin, Ranburne, Fruithurst, Edwardsville, Abernathy, Lake Cleburne, Trickem, I 20 Welcome Center and Sweetwater Lake.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
